Mean functions¶

class limix_inference.mean.LinearMean(size)[source]¶

Linear mean function.

The mathematical representation is

\[f(\mathbf x) = \mathbf x^\intercal \boldsymbol\alpha\]

where \(\boldsymbol\alpha\) is a vector of effect sizes.

derivative_effsizes(x)[source]¶

Linear mean function derivative.

Parameters:size (int) – sample size.
Returns:\(\mathbf x\).
effsizes¶

Effect-sizes parameter.

value(x)[source]¶

Mean function evaluated at x.

Parameters:x (array_like) – sample or samples.
Returns:\(\mathbf x^\intercal \boldsymbol\alpha\).
class limix_inference.mean.OffsetMean[source]¶

Offset mean function.

The mathematical representation is

\[f(n) = o \mathbf 1\]

where \(\mathbf 1\) is a \(n\)-sized vector of ones.

derivative_offset(size)[source]¶

Offset function derivative.

Parameters:size (int) – sample size.
Returns:\(\mathbf 1\).
offset¶

Offset parameter.

value(size)[source]¶

Offset function evaluated for size samples.

Parameters:size (int) – sample size.
Returns:\(o \mathbf 1\).
class limix_inference.mean.SumMean(means)[source]¶
